SENT.plain: We report a case of cavernous sinus thrombosis in an 8-year-old boy, following a neglected and untreated nasal furuncle
This rare entity is manifested by hyperthermia, with headache, vomiting and involvement of the III-IV & VI cranial nerves
It is usually a complication of a facial infection
The diagnosis is established by CT-Scan or MRI
Without appropriate and early treatment, the prognosis is poor, with a fatal outcome or severe sequelae
